alert.note: Alert for Box Elder; Davis; Tooele; Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 10 at 3:03PM MST until January 10 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Weber County in northern Utah... Southeastern Box Elder County in northern Utah... Western Davis County in northern Utah... Northeastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 330 PM MST. * At 302 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Hooper to Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway to near Clive, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 337 and 349. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 53 and 81. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Hill Air Force Base, Roy, Clearfield, Syracuse, Clinton, North Ogden, Riverdale, Hooper, Marriott-Slaterville, Delle, Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway, West Haven, West Point, Pleasant View, Farr West, Harrisville, Plain City, Sunset, and Hat Island. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
